workflow.name: change_building_location
workflow.description: Change the building location

arguments.display_name: Find and replace option from existing weather file name.
arguments.name: epw_gsub

workflow.name: create_and_assign_thermal_zones_for_unassigned_spaces
workflow.display_name: Create and Assign Thermal Zones for Unassigned Spaces
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Create and Assign Thermal Zones for Unassigned Spaces
workflow.description: If any spaces are not part of a thermal zone, then this measure will create a new thermal zone and assign it to the space.

workflow.name: surface_matching_diagnostic
workflow.description: This will look for surfaces in adjacent spaces with similar geometry and create thermal connections between them.

arguments.display_name: Remove Duplicate Vertices in the Same Surface
arguments.name: remove_duplicate_vertices

arguments.display_name: Remove Collinear Vertices in the Same Surface.
arguments.name: remove_collinear_vertices

workflow.name: zedgk_12_electric_equipment
workflow.description: This measure removes all existing electric equipment from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types. One exception is that loads assigned directly to a space where the load definition contains "Elev" or "elev" will be left alone. New electric equipment will be added based on the K12 ZEDG recommendations. Kitchen equipment won't be altered by this measure. There is a stand alone ZEDG measure specifically for the kitchen.

arguments.display_name: Material and Installation Costs for Electric Equipment per Floor Area ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_ip

workflow.name: aedg_k_12_electric_equipment_controls
workflow.description: This measure reduces the values associated with electric equipment schedules to simulate reductions due to equipment controls throughout the building. This includes occupancy based outlets or adapters, as well as network or timer based controls. Kitchen equipment controls are not altered by this measure. The kitchen has a dedicated measure of its own which includes equipment controls.

arguments.display_name: Total cost for all Equipment Controls in the Building ($).
arguments.name: costTotal

workflow.name: zedgk_12_interior_lighting
workflow.description: This measure removes all existing electric equipment objects from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types, with the exception of the kitchen which has a dedicated measure that should be used. New equipment will be added based on the Net Zero K12 recommendations.

arguments.display_name: Material and Installation Costs for Lights per Floor Area ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_ip

workflow.name: aedg_k_12_interior_lighting_controls
workflow.description: This measure reduces the values associated with lighting schedules to simulate reductions due to vacancy sensors throughout the building.

arguments.display_name: Total cost for all Lighting Controls in the Building ($).
arguments.name: costTotal

workflow.name: zedgk_12_exterior_wall_construction
workflow.description: This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.

arguments.display_name: Increase Cost per Area of Construction Where Insulation was Improved ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_insulation_increase_ip

workflow.name: zedgk_12_roof_construction
workflow.description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

arguments.display_name: Increase Cost per Area of Construction Where Insulation was Improved ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_insulation_increase_ip

arguments.display_name: Increase Cost per Area of Construction Where Solar Reflectance Index (SRI) was Improved. ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_sri_increase_ip

workflow.name: aedg_k_12_interior_finishes
workflow.description: This measure will adjust the visible reflectance of materials used on interior building surfaces. Different target values will be set for floors, ceilings, and furniture/interior partition surfaces.

arguments.display_name: Only Check/Alter Interior Partition Surfaces To Meet Furniture Target When They Use This Construction.
arguments.name: object

workflow.name: zedgk_12_fenestration_and_daylighting_controls
workflow.display_name: ZEDG K12 - Fenestration and Daylighting Controls
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: ZEDG K12 - Fenestration and Daylighting Controls
workflow.description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensors will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.

arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed Daylighting Window Constructions ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: cost_daylight_glazing

arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed View Window Constructions ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: cost_view_glazing

arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed Exterior Shading Surface Construction ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: cost_shading_surface

arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed Light Shelf Construction ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: cost_light_shelf

argument.display_name: Skip ZEDG K12 - Fenestration and Daylighting Controls
argument.name: __SKIP__

variables.display_name: Skip ZEDG K12 - Fenestration and Daylighting Controls

workflow.name: zedgk_12_exterior_door_construction
workflow.description: This measure is intended for use on opaque doors; if doors are glass they should be treated as windows. OpenStudio does have a unique object for overhead doors versus standard doors. This measure doesn't alter infiltration. There is a separate measure for infiltration.

arguments.display_name: Increase Cost per Area of Construction Where Insulation was Improved ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_insulation_increase_ip

workflow.name: zedgk_12_envelope_infiltration
workflow.description: This measure addresses total building infiltration values.

arguments.display_name: Total cost for all Envelope Improvements ($).
arguments.name: costTotalEnvelopeInfiltration

workflow.name: zedgk_12_swh
workflow.description: Use 90% efficient natural gas-fired storage tank water heater. Water use demand is caluclated per student.

workflow.name: zedgk_12_kitchen
workflow.description: Electric equipment added per ZEDG recommendations for kitchens. Refrigeration is included in the plug loads.

workflow.name: aedg_k_12_exterior_lighting
workflow.description: This measure will create exterior lights objects in four different categories described below. The lighting levels and controls will be based on the "How to Implement Recommendations" section in the AEDG; any existing exterior lighting will be removed. A special input is needed for this measure to define the exterior lighting zone, which further describes whether the site is urban or rural.

arguments.display_name: Wall Coverage Area for Decorative Facade Lighting (ft^2)
arguments.name: facadeLandscapeLighting

arguments.display_name: Ground Coverage Area for Parking Lots and Drives Lighting (ft^2)
arguments.name: parkingDrivesLighting

arguments.display_name: Ground Coverage Area for Walkway and Plaza Lighting (ft^2)
arguments.name: walkwayPlazaSpecialLighting

arguments.display_name: Total cost for all Exterior Lighting ($).
arguments.name: costTotalExteriorLights

workflow.name: add_electric_equipment_instance_to_space
workflow.display_name: Add Electric Equipment Instance to Space
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Add Electric Equipment Instance to Space
workflow.description: This measure allows you to create new electric equipment instance and assign it directly to a space in the model. It requires that the schedule and electric equipment definition already exist in the model. Additionally it has arguments for target space and multiplier

workflow.name: add_electric_equipment_instance_to_space_2
workflow.display_name: Add Electric Equipment Instance to Space 2
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Add Electric Equipment Instance to Space 2
workflow.description: This measure allows you to create new electric equipment instance and assign it directly to a space in the model. It requires that the schedule and electric equipment definition already exist in the model. Additionally it has arguments for target space and multiplier

arguments.name: schedule
arguments.default_value: Art Kiln Firing Schedule Primary 10x year
arguments.value: Art Kiln Firing Schedule Primary 10x year

workflow.name: add_rooftop_pv
workflow.description: This measure will create new shading surface geometry above the roof for each thermal zone inyour model where the surface azmith falls within the user specified range. Arguments are exposed for panel efficiency, inverter efficiency, and the fraction of each roof surface that has PV.

argument.display_name: Fraction of Surface Area with Active Solar Cells
argument.name: fraction_of_surface

variables.display_name: Fraction of Surface Area with Active Solar Cells
variables.display_name_short: Fraction of Surface Area with Active Solar Cells

workflow.name: set_thermostat_schedules
workflow.description: Sets zone thermostat schedules to schedules in the same file. If a zone does not have a thermostat this measure will add one

arguments.display_name: Choose Thermal Zones to change thermostat schedules on.
arguments.name: zones

arguments.display_name: Material and Installation Costs per Thermal Zone ($/thermal zone).
arguments.name: material_cost

workflow.name: set_thermostat_schedules_2
workflow.description: Sets zone thermostat schedules to schedules in the same file. If a zone does not have a thermostat this measure will add one

arguments.display_name: Choose Thermal Zones to change thermostat schedules on.
arguments.name: zones

arguments.display_name: Material and Installation Costs per Thermal Zone ($/thermal zone).
arguments.name: material_cost

workflow.name: nze_hvac
workflow.description: This measure replaces the existing HVAC system if any with the user selected HVAC system.  The user can select how to partition the system, applying it to the whole building, a system per building type, a system per building story, or automatically partition based on residential/non-residential occupany types and space loads.

arguments.name: hvac_system_type
arguments.default_value: DOAS with fan coil chiller with central air source heat pump
arguments.value: DOAS with fan coil chiller with boiler

arguments.display_name: DOAS capable of demand control ventilation?
arguments.name: doas_dcv

workflow.name: create_baseline_building
workflow.description: Creates the Performance Rating Method baseline building.  For 90.1, this is the Appendix G aka LEED Baseline.  For India ECBC, this is the Appendix D Baseline.  Note: for 90.1, this model CANNOT be used for code compliance; it is not the same as the Energy Cost Budget baseline.

workflow.name: zedgk_12_insert_ground_domain_basement_e_kusdua
workflow.display_name: ZEDG K12 Insert Ground Domain E+ Kusdua
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: ZEDG K12 Insert Ground Domain E+ Kusdua
workflow.description: Measure to insert the EnergyPlus Site:GroundDomain:Slab object into the model and, when recommended, horizontal and vertical insulation.

arguments.display_name: Set Minimum Number of Warmup Days
arguments.name: min_warmup_days

workflow.name: tariff_selection_flat
workflow.description: This measure sets flat rates for electricity, gas, water, district heating, and district cooling.

workflow.name: openstudio_results
workflow.description: This measure creates high level tables and charts pulling both from model inputs and EnergyPlus results. It has building level information as well as detail on space types, thermal zones, HVAC systems, envelope characteristics, and economics. Click the heading above a chart to view a table of the chart data.

workflow.name: envelope_and_internal_load_breakdown
workflow.description: Report provides annual and monthly views into heat gains and losses for envelope and internal loads.

options.name: Aurora
options.description: Option 11 Description: Change the building location

options.description: Option 1 Description: If any spaces are not part of a thermal zone, then this measure will create a new thermal zone and assign it to the space.

options.description: This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.

options.description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

options.description: This measure will adjust the visible reflectance of materials used on interior building surfaces. Different target values will be set for floors, ceilings, and furniture/interior partition surfaces.

options.name: zedgk_12_fenestration_and_daylighting_controls
options.description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensors will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.

options.name: zedgk_12_exterior_door_construction
options.description: This measure is intended for use on opaque doors; if doors are glass they should be treated as windows. OpenStudio does have a unique object for overhead doors versus standard doors. This measure doesn't alter infiltration. There is a separate measure for infiltration.

options.name: zedgk_12_envelope_infiltration
options.description: This measure addresses total building infiltration values.

options.name: ZEDG SWH Primary
options.description: Option 1 Description: Todo - update this to use electric. Measure replaces existing swh equipment (if any) with the swh equipment recommendations of the 50% K-12 AEDG.

options.name: ZEDG Kitchen Primary
options.description: Option 1 Description: Todo - update this to use electric. Measure replaces existing kitchen equipment (if any) with refrigeration, electric, and gas equipment that align with the kitchen equipment recommendations of the 50% K-12 AEDG.

options.name: AEDG Ext Lighting Baseline
options.description: Option 2 Description: This measure will create exterior lights objects in four different categories described below. The lighting levels and controls will be based on the "How to Implement Recommendations" section in the AEDG; any existing exterior lighting will be removed. A special input is needed for this measure to define the exterior lighting zone, which further describes whether the site is urban or rural.

options.name: Elevators
options.description: Option 1 Description: This measure allows you to create new electric equipment instance and assign it directly to a space in the model. It requires that the schedule and electric equipment definition already exist in the model. Additionally it has arguments for target space and multiplier

options.name: Electric Kiln
options.description: Option 1 Description: This measure allows you to create new electric equipment instance and assign it directly to a space in the model. It requires that the schedule and electric equipment definition already exist in the model. Additionally it has arguments for target space and multiplier

options.name: add_rooftop_pv
options.description: This measure will create new shading surface geometry above the roof for each thermal zone inyour model where the surface azmith falls within the user specified range. Arguments are exposed for panel efficiency, inverter efficiency, and the fraction of each roof surface that has PV.

options.name: Thermostat Typical
options.description: Option 1 Description: Sets zone thermostat schedules to schedules in the same file. If a zone does not have a thermostat this measure will add one

options.name: Thermostat Gym
options.description: Option 1 Description: Sets zone thermostat schedules to schedules in the same file. If a zone does not have a thermostat this measure will add one

options.name: nze_hvac
options.description: This measure replaces the existing HVAC system if any with the user selected HVAC system.  The user can select how to partition the system, applying it to the whole building, a system per building type, a system per building story, or automatically partition based on residential/non-residential occupany types and space loads.

options.name: Baseline 5B 2007
options.description: Option 11 Description: Creates the Performance Rating Method baseline building.  For 90.1, this is the Appendix G aka LEED Baseline.  For India ECBC, this is the Appendix D Baseline.  Note: for 90.1, this model CANNOT be used for code compliance; it is not the same as the Energy Cost Budget baseline.

options.description: Option 1 Description: This measure sets flat rates for electricity, gas, water, district heating, and district cooling.

options.description: Option 1 Description: Report provides annual and monthly views into heat gains and losses for envelope and internal loads.

options.name: Aurora
options.description: Option 11 Description: Change the building location

options.name: Create Zones
options.description: Option 1 Description: If any spaces are not part of a thermal zone, then this measure will create a new thermal zone and assign it to the space.

options.name: Surface Matching Diagnostic
options.description: Option 1 Description: This will look for surfaces in adjacent spaces with similar geometry and create thermal connections between them.

options.name: ZEDG Elec Equip
options.description: Option 1 Description: Customized values for ZEDG - This measure removes all existing electric equipment from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types. One exception is that loads assigned directly to a space whre the load definition contains "Elev" or "elev" will be left alone. New electric equipment will be added based on the 50% K12 AEDG recommendations. Kitchen equipment wont' be altered by this measure. There is a stand alone AEDG measure specifically for the kitchen.

options.name: AEDG Elec Equip Controls
options.description: Option 1 Description

options.name: ZEDG Int Lighting
options.description: Option 1 Description

options.name: AEDG Int Lighting Controls
options.description: Option 1 Description

options.name: ZEDG Ext Wall
options.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, currently only set for steel frame walls. This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.

options.name: ZEDG Roof
options.description: Option 1 Description: ZEDG version, only setup for IEAD roof. This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

options.description: Option 1 Description

options.name: ZEDG Fenistration with Daylighting
options.description: Option 2 Description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Net Zero K12 recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensor will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.

options.name: ZEDG Exterior Door
options.description: Option 1 Description: This measure is intended for use on opaque doors; if doors are glass they should be treated as windows. OpenStudio does have a unique object for overhead doors versus standard doors. This measure doesn't alter infiltration. There is a separate measure for infiltration.
